intro: Galium aparine proles tenerum, commonly known as common bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems that are often hairy and covered with small, hooked bristles. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a serrated margin. Galium aparine proles tenerum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, disturbed soils such as roadsides and meadows.
